<Overload retVal="" descr="Set limits on the absolute focus reached during autofocus runs. Follow with a and a limit as given by ReportAbsoluteFocus, or 0 0 to cancel these limits. Autofocus will abort when a limit is exceeded." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Adds a - pair to the last section of the autodoc associated with the current open file, if any. The next word after the command is the key, and the remainder of the text on the line is taken as the value. Variables are substituted before using the text. After one or more additions to a section of the autodoc, a WriteAutodoc command must be used to save the values before closing the file or saving another image to it." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Adds a - pair to the last section of the autodoc opened with the Open .mdoc for Frames command. This works just like AddToAutodoc, but the WriteFrameMdoc command must be used instead after adding values." >

Do not stack Falcon intermediate frames after the next exposure. To stack frames from multiple exposures into one stack, use this command before each exposure except the last one.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Switches to given " >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Return as early as possible from the next acquisition, which must involve saving dose-fractionation frames from a K2 camera. Follow with the of frames to be summed in the returned image, 0 to return without any summed image, or -1 to return with the full sum (the latter is available only on GMS 2.31 or higher). Single-shot and dose-fractionation images can be requested without delay in the macro. The single-shot images will be taken as soon as possible (after the end of the exposure before GMS 2.31, after the frame stack has been accessed in GMS 2.31 and higher). Another dose-fractionation shot will be delayed until saving is finished for the current shot." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Prints the to the log window" >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Report the min, max, mean, and SD of the A buffer, or of the indicated scaled to electrons, and also report the electrons per unbinned pixel per second. The camera must have a defined counts per electron." >

Overload.descr: Inside of an If/Endif block, starts a block that is executed if the expression after the 'If' and any preceding 'Elseif' commands is false

expression Inside of an If/Endif block, starts a block that is executed conditionally on the value of 'expression' if the expressions in the starting If statement and any preceding Elseif statements were not true.

Overload.descr: Acquire image with 'preview' parameters

List the names of macro-callable functions in all loaded plugins along with the arguments that they expect, in parentheses. For each argument, there should be one item provided on the command line calling the function, with all items separated by spaces as usual. Two exceptions to this are: a string argument at the end can include spaces; an argument listed as [out]double is a returned value, assigned to reportedValue2 or higher.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Loads the cartridge from the given (numbered from 1) if there is an autoloader." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="A longer to appear in the Run submenu of the Macro menu; if this name is not defined, the regular MacroName appears there." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Starts one or more time-consuming s: Buffer cycle (Bu), Refill refrigerant (Re), Inventory cassettes (In), Loader buffer cycle (Lo), Dark reference update for K2 (Da). Operations are identified by the first two letters of whatever full word you use (case insensitive). Each operation except Inventory must be followed by an in hours. If is > 0, the operation is done only if the time since the last such operation is greater than ; if is 0, the operation is done unconditionally; if is < 0, it simply records the current time as the time of the last operation. The scope operations will occur sequentially and be started in the order that they are listed. The dark reference update will be done simultaneously with scope operations. If an error occurs in a scope operation, other operations will be finished and the error reported at the end. Errors other than in refilling refrigerant will cause the macro to stop. The user interface should not hang during long operations, and users will be asked to confirm that they want to kill the operation threads if they press STOP or try to exit the program. The consequences of killing these threads are uncertain." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Loop the given of times until EndLoop; optionally set with index" >

Report an absolute (standardized) value for the current focus setting
Report sum of shifts given by ReportAlignShift or ReportShiftDiffFrom
Report the X and Y alignment shift of the current image in A in unbinned pixels on image, in nanometers along the image shift axes, and in nanometers on the specimen, where the tilt axis is along X.

Report the sum of left and right borders and the sum of top and bottom borders in the last autoalign for the image in A and for the reference image. The numbers are in pixels of the respective images before the additional binning applied for correlation, and will thus differ from the binned values reported by the autoalign routine.

Report measured defocus from last autofocus

Same as 'ReportAbsoluteFocus', which is a better description of the operation
Report the drift estimate from the last autofocus, if available
Reports whether a frame .mdoc file is open; sets ReportedValue1 to 1 if so.

For the current Navigator item or the item this macro is being run on, reports a code for whether the item is first to be acquired in a group: -1 if Navigator not acquiring, 0 if not in a group, 1 if first to be acquired in a group, 2 if later in the group. If the group would show up on more than one line with 'Collapse groups' on, a value of 1 is returned for the first item to be acquired in each subgroup. It also reports the group ID of the item (ID is 0 for an item not in a group).
Report the illuminated area on a Titan
Report the image shift in IS units, adjusted for tilt axis offset, image shift offset, and low dose area shift
Reports the lateral offset of the tilt axis estimated from the last Refine Eucentricity run; aborts the macro if no offset is available.
Report whether low dose is on or not and the current area, if it is defined. The number of the area (0 for V, etc.) is placed in ReportedValue2.
Report the current mag; also set ReportedValue2 to 1 if low mag mode, 0 if not
Report the current mag index; also set ReportedValue2 to 1 if low mag mode, 0 if not

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Report the mean counts of the A buffer, or of the indicated ; set to 1 to get unbinned counts per second" >

Overload.descr: Report the index, stage X, Y, Z, label, and note string for the current Navigator item, or the item this macro is being run on. The index and stage coordinates are placed in 'reportedValue' variables as usual, and the item type is placed in 'reportedValue5' (0 for point, 1 for polygon, 2 for map). In addition, variables 'navLabel', and 'navNote' are set with the label and note strings, and variables 'navIndex' and 'navIntLabel' are set with integer values of the item index (numbered from 1) and of the label (up to any non-numeric characters). If the Navigator is currently acquiring at points, a variable 'navAcqIndex' is set with the number of items already acquired plus 1. Any of these variables can then be used to make filenames, and the latter two can be used in arithmetic and IF statements.
Report the X and Y values of the objective stigmator, between -1 and 1

<Overload retVal="" descr="Restore one or all camera parameter set(s) modified with the 'Set' commands above. If is omitted, all modified sets will be restored. The set can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes." >

Overload.descr: Saves the current focus; the focus will be restored to this value either by RestoreFocus or when the macro stops or exits. The macro will not be resumable if it stops.

Closes the log window and opens a new one. If a log file has been saved, the log is automatically saved to it before closing. If there is no log file and the log has new contents since program startup, the program will ask the user whether to save to log first; if the user cancels, the macro is aborted.

However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the acquisition area for exposure . Follow the set specifier S with either 4 numbers for the unbinned , , , and coordinates (the same kind of numbers as in the camera setup dialog) or with F, H, Q, WH or WQ for full, half, quarter, wide half, or wide quarter. Values will be adjusted for a legal area. The can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Set exposure for acquisition from a centered area. Follow the specifier with 3 numbers: the binning B, the binned size in X, and the binned size in Y. The can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Close column/gun valve or turn off filament if is 0; open valve or turn on filament if is 1" >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the acquisition mode for exposure for continuous if is non-zero, or single-frame if is 0. The can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the defocus to the given in microns" >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Change the working directory to , which can contain spaces." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the energy loss to the " >

Overload.descr: If in low mag, sets to the standard focus for the current mag or nearest LM mag if one has been set; otherwise on FEI it assumes standard focus is 0 and on JEOL it stops with an error. If not in LM, sets to the standard focus for the nearest nonLM mag if one has been set or stops with an an error if none were set. On FEI scopes, it issues a warning if it is using a calibrated value from a different mag.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Set exposure and, optionally, drift settling for exposure to the given values and . If D is omitted, the existing drift settling will be unchanged. The can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes." >

Overload.descr: Set the image shift to the given values (image shift units). The values correspond to the ones give by ReportImageShift, which are adjusted for tilt axis offset, image shift offset, and low dose area shift
Adjust beam intensity by the change in cosine of the tilt angle from the last tilt change. In low dose mode, this changes the intensity only of the Record area.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Adjust beam intensity to yield the given of counts, based on counts in the tilt-foreshortened area of the image in A. In low dose mode, this operates only on Record images and will change the intensity only of the Record area." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the of the usual settling time to apply in continuous mode after image shift or stage movement. By default, no settling is applied in continuous mode (i.e., the fraction is 0), but some settling may be needed when a macro or other operation is using continuous frames. The fraction is reset to zero when continuous mode ends." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Turns low dose on for nonzero or off for 0; the previous state of low dose is saved in ReportedValue1 as a 0 or 1." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the to an actual film mag value" >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the to the actual film mag value and change the beam to maintain the same brightness. Two values are reported: the initial percent C2 value and the remaining factor of intensity change needed if it was not possible to change the intensity by the full amount needed. The C2 value should be used to restore intensity when the mag is restored. The remaining intensity change could be applied to the exposure time if necessary. The macro will stop if there is an error in the intensity change." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Sets up to 6 montage parameters; enter a value or -1 to leave the parameter unchanged. The entries are: 1 to use movement or 0 not to; overlap in X; overlap in Y; frame size in X; frame size in Y, 1 to correlations or 0 not to." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Set to 0 to open files as MRC, or 1 to open files as a TIFF described in an image autodoc file. The optional second sets whether to open montaged files as MRC or as a TIFF series, but only if the property MontageAutodocOptions is set." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Calls SetObjFocus on JEOL with the given , an integer increment, and reports change in focus" >

Overload.descr: Set the objective lens stigmator to the given values (between -1 and 1)

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Set the C2/C3 lens to the given percentage, or illuminated area on Titan to given value in microns." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Sets the to microprobe or nanoprobe on an FEI scope. Follow with 0 or 'nano' for nanoprobe, or 1 or 'micro' for microprobe." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Set the STEM s for each available channel of exposure . Follow the set specifier with a detector number for each channel, numbered from 0, or -1 to select no detector for that channel. At least one actual detector must be specified. The can be specified as either V, F, T, R, P or 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 for view, focus, trial, record, preview, respectively. Parameters will be restored whenever the macro ends or stops or when a different camera is selected. However, if the macro is suspended, any changed parameters will be set again when the macro resumes." >
<Overload retVal="" descr="Insert the slit; or if is entered, insert if 1 or retract if 0" >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Same as 'SetAbsoluteFocus', which is preferred to avoid confusion with the calibrated standard or eucentric focus " >

Overload.descr: Set the defocus target to value

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Open a montage file or adjust the current file's properties so that it will hold an image of the cross-line (waffle) replica grating with at least in X and Y at the current magnification. Follow with the of blocks and the of the file to be opened if necessary. If montaging is not needed, no changes are made. If there is an existing montage that is adequate, its properties will be adjusted to work at the current mag. If a new montage is needed, it will close the current file if it is a montage and open a new one with the given name. Variables will be substituted, so the name can contain the mag index, for example. It sets reportedValue1 to 1 or 0 depending on whether montaging is needed or not." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Keeps projector lens normalization from being done before the next image or stage shift calibration provided that normalization was last done at the current magnification. Follow with an optional 0 to NOT normalization." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Apply image shift during the next exposure to compensate for a drift in and given by the first and second numbers; the third number should be 0 if the is in unbinned pixels/sec and 1 if it is in nm/sec" >

Overload.descr: Shift items at the current registration by the alignment shift of the image in buffer A. If rerun on the same image, it applied the change in shift between the current and previous run.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Display the given (e.g., Show C)" >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Sets the current montage to skip pieces outside the Navigator item whose in the table (numbered from 1). If is 0, uses the current item. If is < 0, disables the skipping of pieces." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Skips forward to the line starting with the given , where the label has a colon (:) at the end of it and is the only item on the line. The colon is not included in the label in the SkipTo statement." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Change focus linearly through next exposure. Follow with 2 numbers, the and defocus relative to the current focus. This command and StepFocusNextShot are enabled for Gatan, Falcon, and Tietz cameras." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Expose film with special handling: the first specifies a in seconds after loading the plate; the second number specifies a -exposure of the specimen before exposing the plate, in seconds. The third suppresses of the screen if it is nonzero. This command command does not raise the screen if it is down. It requires the adaexp server to be installed." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Do one or two focus changes during the next exposure. Follow with 2 or 4 numbers: the in seconds from start of the exposure to the first focus change, the first change in microns, the from start of the exposure to the second focus change if any, and the second change relative to the starting focus, not relative to the focus after the first change. The command will have no effect if the exposure time is less than the time to the first change, and the second change will not be done if the time for it is greater than the exposure time." >

Overload.descr: Stops continuous acquisition if it is running.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Report the mean counts in a subarea of the A buffer from to in X and from to in Y. Coordinates are numbered from 0 to size - 1 in each dimension and 0 in Y is at the top." >

Acquire image with 'trial' parameters
Tilt up by preset increment
If there is an autoloader, unloads the cartridge.

Assign current stage Z value to the whole group that the current Navigator item, or item that this macro is being run on, belongs to. The item must have a non-zero group ID. If the group would show up on more than one line with 'Collapse groups' on, items on all lines will be updated, unlike with the 'Update Z' button.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Updates the K2 hardware dark reference if the known interval since the last update is longer than in hours. If value is 0, the update is done unconditionally; if value is negative (-1), it simply records the current time as the time of the last update." >

Overload.descr: Assign current stage Z value to the current Navigator item, or item that this macro is being run on.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="If is non-zero, the macro will keep executing commands (such as stage movement and alignment) even when the camera is acquiring in continuous mode. Use 0 to return to normal operation, in which the macro will wait for continuous acquisition to be ended by the user." >

<Overload retVal="" descr="Open a directory chooser dialog to allow user to select or make a directory, and change the working directory to it. If the optional string is not supplied, the dialog title is 'Choose a new current working directory'. The chosen directory is stored in ReportedValue1." >

Overload.descr: Acquire image with 'view' parameters

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Turns echoing of each macro line on or off for 1 or 0" >

Overload.descr: Acquire image with 'view' parameters

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Start accumulating and wait until it reaches the given value in electrons per square Angstrom. Enter the optional value to set how many times it progress while waiting (default is 10). Be sure that the screen is down and, if in low dose, that the beam is unblanked." >

Overload.descr: After starting a continuous acquisition, use this command to wait until the next image becomes available. The program will wait until the exposure time has elapsed so that the image is likely to be taken after completion of previous operations. The 'UseContinuousFrames 1' command must be used before the acquisition is started.

AutoComplete.KeyWord: <Overload retVal="" descr="Tilt up to given in steps and track image position" >

Overload.descr: Writes the autodoc associated with the current open file. Use this command once after adding one or more values to a section of the autodoc.
Writes the frame autodoc file; use this command after adding one or more values to a section.
